results.title: Australian diary. No. 136
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Four generations: Golden Jubilee of War Veteran’s Homes; four generations of ex-servicemen have benefited from this service. Camp Southern Cross: International camp is one of the activities held throughout the world to celebrate the Diamond Jubilee Of Guiding. Held at Britannia Park, in the Dandenongs, Vic. January 1970. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian gazette. No. 363
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Adelaide dog show; Bronzetti wins the Caulfield Cup against Chrome and Rael Loein; Rocket wins the Sydney Flying Squadron’s handicap in the opening event of the sailing season on Sydney Harbour and 85 unions are represented at the annual eight hour day demonstrations.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 132
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Drought, A sheep station in N.S.W. faces ruin because of one of the worst-ever droughts; rain has not fallen for 18 months and water for limited use is brought in by truck. Bundaberg: the Queensland coastal port which serves a rich agricultural area with a near tropical climate and rich volcanic soil. Birth place of the famous airman, Bert Hinkler, it is a prosperous city which thrives on the extensive sugar cane industry. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 127
results.creator_credit: R.J. Edwards, Australian National Film Board and Department of the Interior
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Shows the survey vessel H.M.A.S. Moresby at work and the training of paratroops; William Ricketts, the well known sculptor of Australian aborigines and their legends; Shows the Sesqui-centennial celebrations at Bathurst, N.S.W.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 123
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan, Australian National Film Board and Dept of the Interior
results.brief_description: Magazine items: The giant telescope at Parkes, N.S.W. is the largest in the Southern Hemisphere. It is occupied with a fulltime research programme into radio astronomy. At Collaroy, Sydney, the Salvation Army has organized a unique Music Camp for children,from eight to fifteen years. University College of Townsville is the first in the state of Queensland outside Brisbane.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 122
results.brief_description: Magazine items: The Australian Consumers’ Association test on the durability of children’s shoes; a display in South Australia for prospective buyers and pilots of light aircraft; a dazzling exhibition by Horace lindrum, last of five generations of Lindrums, all of whom have proved masters on the billiard table.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 103
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: postage stamps provide an opportunity to recapture history in miniature and a new standard gauge railway links Maree and Port Augusta.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 043. Three Directions in Pop Music
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Peter Weir and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Offers a sample of three trends in recent Australian pop music: the theatrical act of Wendy Saddington and Teardrop; the jug music of the Captain Matchbox Whoopee Band; and the popular rock group Indelible Murtceps.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 041. Sydney Opera House
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Roland Beckett and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Progress report on the construction of the Opera House, with construction almost complete and fitting out well advanced. Includes views of the curtains of the sun and moon.
